content:
C. Judges in Isreal    D false prophets 
 
26. “It is enough; now O LORD, take away my life; for 
I am no better than my fathers.” the prayer above 
was said by Elijah when 
A. ran out of food 
B. had no water to drink at the brook Cherith 
C. learnt that Ahab was looking for him 
D. was threatened by Jezebel 
 
27. In his effort to rebuild the walls of Jerusalem, 
Nehemiah prayed against insults of 
A. Tobiah and Sanbaliat 
B. Amon and Shallum 
C. Nebuchadnezzer and Tobiah 
D. Geshem and Hulda 
 
28. According to Luke, Jesus healed the epileptic boy by 
A. telling the boy to have faith 
B. rebuking the unclean spirit 
C. binding the evil spirite in him 
D. touching the boy 
 
29. According to Luke Jesus last words on the cross were 
A. “ I thirst”B. woman behold your son 
C. “father, into thy hands I commit my spirit” 
D. “father , forgive them; for they know not 
what they do” 
 
30. ‘Father Abraham, have mercy upon me, and send 
Lazarus .... Abraham could not grant the rich man’s 
request because’ 
A. the rich man lived in luxury while on earth 
B. there was a chasm between them 
C. he had no pity on the rich man 
D. his dogs used to lick Lazaurus’s sores 
 
31. In the story of the transfiguration of Jesus, Moses, 
Elijah represented the 
A. Old testament saints 
B. glory of God 
C. end of the age 
D. law and the prophets 
 
32. but he who enters by the door is the shepheredof 
the sheep ...... the door in the 
statement refers to 
A. the law  B. the gospel 
C Peter D. Jesus  
 
33. In order to fufil the law of Moses, Jesus told the 
leper He had healed to go and 
A. proclaim the good news 
B. show himself to his household 
C. show himself to the priest 
D. make sacrifice to God 
 
34. The Jewish religious leaders arrested and 
imprisoned the apostles the second time because 
A. they performed miracles in the name of Jesus 
B. they disobeyed the law 
C. the high priest and the Sadducees excused 
them of treason 
D. the high priest and the Sadducees were jealous 
 
35. After the mission of the seventy, Jesus declared 
that he had given 
A. the gift of healing  B. power over 
the roman authorities C. authority over all the 
power of the enemy D.the gift of knowledge 
of the word 
 
36. Jesus did not go immediately to attend to Lazarus 
who has reported sick because he 
A. wanted His disciples to believe in Him 
B. was too busy attending to her people 
C. did not know how serious the sickness was 
D. careless about Lazarus 
 
37. In the parable of the wheat and tares, the harvest 
time refers to the 
A. white judgement throne 
B. millennium reign of christ 
C. tribulation period 
D. close of the age 
 
38. Peter teaches that good Christian conduct is 
characterized by love and 
A. impartial judgement 
B. forbearance C. fear of God 
D. hardwork 
 
39. Paul teaches that the excercise of spiritual gifts by 
individual believers should be used to promote 
A. faith B. cooperation C. competition 
D. Knowledge 
40. Peter advises the elders to tend the flock of God with 
A. authority and compassion 
B. a willing and cheeful heart 
C. knowledge and understanding 
D. zeal and credibilty 
 
41. Paul warned the Thessalonians against the deciet 
of false teachers concerning 
A. their salvation in Christ 
B. activities of the man of sins 
C. the resurrection of the dead 
D. the second coming of Christ 
 
42. Paul described the gifts he received from the 
Philipians as 
A. peace offering B. treasure in heaven 
C. pleasin to God D. free will offering 
 
43. According to Paul, the purpose of the law is 
A. to increase the knowledge of sin 
B. tobring about justification by the faith 
C. the fulfilment of divine promise 
D. to promote the faith in the cruccified Christ 
 
44. The man who stirred up the people against Paul in 
Ephesus was 
A. Alexander B. Aristarchus C. Demetrius 
D. Gaius
